page.title: 01The village of Thorney
page.content: {Thorney}is a small village 9 miles east of{Peterborough.}Thorney was originally an island called{The Isle {of Thorns.}The{Abbey}in Thorney dates back{900}years. The{A47}runs through Thorney from Peterborough to Norwich which makes it noisy and dangerous especially in summer. Our village is surrounded by the fens ,which is ideal land for the many farms,whose fields are separated by dykes. Thorney has a combination of old and new houses. Our village provides much of its own entertainment, catering for all ages from{5}to{80.} We have a primary school in Thorney called the{Duke of Bedford School. We have a variety of shops including a{post office.}There are two{police {houses}and one{fire station.}We also have our own{bus company.}We have a {blacksmith}and a{saddler.}
